text:
Set in the 1990s, Captain Marvel follows Danvers, an Air Force officer, as she becomes one of the universe's most powerful heroes after earth gets involved in a galactic war between alien. The film boasts many notable performances from Oscar winners Brie Larson, Samuel L.
Captain Marvel review: This superhero debut does NOT go to infinity - Cineplex Magazine - News, reviews and behind-the-scenes stories about movies and movie magic...
Brie Larsons portrayal of Carol Danvers/Captain Marvel is solid, though somewhat underwhelming at times. It was clear that she had done her research on the character and was enthusiastic during our conversation.
Her character is both strong and vulnerable, which added depth to her role.
When compared to other origin stories like Wonder Womans, Thor, and The Hulk, this film lacks in intensity, humor, and compelling narrative threads.
We are introduced to so many plot lines early on in the first act with various themes, characters, and backstories being established. While we learn how Carol obtained her powers from her DNA combining with Mar-Vell (Jude Law) after being saved as they attempted to flee Skrull territory, the explanation felt overly complicated and might confuse some viewers. We then encounter the Skrulls once more through Ben Mendelsohns impressive performance, yet there were too much repetitive CGI-fueled action scenes later on that made them feel less threatening or engaging.
Despite having multiple timelines/flashbacks and plot twists, it can sometimes become challenging to keep track; even for someone familiar with the comics.
